reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Northern Kenya integrated development project (NOTKID)

description.narrative: Limited livelihood opportunities and lack of natural resources are the main conflict drivers between pastoralist communities in Northern Kenya. The defining feature of the targeted area is aridity affecting the livelihood opportunities. Customary (religiou s and traditional leaders) and formal peacebuilding structures have insufficient capacity to implemented conflict resolution and management. Project complements peacebuilding work In West Pokot, Baringo, and Samburu. The main objective:The specific objecti ve is to have improved wellbeing for pastoralist women, youth and men in programme areas of arid and semi-arid lands region in Northern Kenya.To improve the capacity of pastoral communities and local governments to resolve and prevent potential conflicts, especially those arising from natural resources.Expected results:Result 1: Pastoralist communities with enhanced livelihood options which can enable them to bounce back to recurring drought or other manmade disastersResult 2: Strengthened capacity on custo mary and formal peace structures to undertake peace building mediation at the grass root levelRight-holders/ beneficiaries:Approximately 1,200 people (men, women, boys and girls) will benefit directly from their participation in the project activities. Dut y-bearers to be worked with:(i) National government authorities such as the three county commissioners, three senators, Sub-county commissioners and the chiefs. (ii) County government authorities including three governors, members of county assemblies, War d admins and sub-county administrators. (iii) Religious and traditional leaders and formal peace structure actors.Implementing partner:Catholic Dioceses of Eldoret, Kitale, and Lodwar.
